messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] Lawrence Fishburn WAS:Shakespeare
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/15/03 9:10:59 AM, elizabethogi@ybb.ne.jp writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/15/03 9:10:59 AM, elizabethogi@... writes:

<< Me too! I love Lawrence (doesen't he have a nickname?)--and especially
when he was Cowboy Curtis singing about "There's all Kinds Of Flowers". >>

I missed that!

I will eventually own all of PeeWee's Playhouse on DVD. That is one of my
life's goals. <g>

On the credits of PeeWee, he was "Larry Fishburne," but that was before he
was all Tony-awarded, Oscar nominated...

Ooh look!

LAURENCE FISHBURNE Actor Fishburne has won both the Tony and Emmy awards. At
age 11 he made regular appearances on TV soap opera One Life To Live . At 14
he spent over a year in the Philippines filming Apocalypse Now . In the 1980s
he appeared on TV, as Cowboy Curtis on Pee Wee's Playhouse . His breakthrough
movie was 1991's Boyz N the Hood , and in 1993 he was nominated for an Oscar
for his portrayal of Ike Turner in What's Love Got To Do With It? . In 1999 he
appeared as Morpheus in the box office hit The Matrix. Laurence Fishburne for
UNICEF
His welcome page as a UNICEF ambassador has a career profile Internet Movie
Database
Complete filmography, brief bio The Matrix
The official movie site in all its glory Matrix 2 and 3
Gossip about the sequels Birth:
30 July 1961 Birthplace:
Augusta, Georgia Death:
Best Known As:
Morpheus in The Matrix
Shop for Posters
at AllPosters.com


HEY!! *I* was born in Augusta, Georgia.
Augusta, Georgia must be a wonderful place.

(I've never been there, not counting being a grub in a hospital for two or
three days, and then my mom went back to Aiken SC where she and my dad and uncle
and aunt were living temporarily with a bunch of other Texans who had been
hired to come do secret welding and pipe-fitting labor on secret atomic
who-knows-what.)

Sandra

messages.subject: Lawrence Fishburn WAS:Shakespeare
messages.msgSnippet: ... Me too! I love Lawrence (doesen t he have a nickname?)--and especially when he was Cowboy Curtis singing about There s all Kinds Of Flowers . I actually
messages.messageBody:
> So I asked Marty if he wanted to watch it with me since it has Lawrence
> Fishburn. Marty and I have been Lawrence Fishburn fans since he was
> Cowboy Curtis
> on PeeWee's Playhouse, and we rooted for him in Searching for Bobby
> Fisher,

Me too! I love Lawrence (doesen't he have a nickname?)--and especially
when he was Cowboy Curtis singing about "There's all Kinds Of Flowers".

I actually saw him recently, without a mob around him, but his bodyguard
had a fierce look on his face, so I let him be...(He's a bit chubbier
nowadays, but still cute).
E.
